name: untangling

present participle of
untangle
untangle verb [T]
(KNOTS)
to remove the knots from an untidy mass of string, wire, etc. and separate the different threads

untangle verb [T]
(PROBLEM)
to make a complicated subject or problem, or its different parts, clear and able to be understood: It took years to untangle the legal complexities of the case.
